attributes.comment:
I have read about the proposed increase in fees associated with I600A application
and fingerprints. As a prospective adoptive parent, I am opposed to the fee
increase. As I have already paid the fee once & it has increased during the time I
have waited for my referral, I feel this increase is undue. In addition, the Chinese
government has slowed referrals drastically to the point most people will face
expiration of their I171 before they receive a child. Thus most of us will have to pay
the I600A fees & fingerprint fees twice in the same adoption. If the I171 &
fingerprints had a longer expiration date, they might warrant increased fees. As
yet, I have seen no change in service to justify any increase in fees especially
since many USCIS offices take 3 months or longer to preocess the application.
Cynthia Williams
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Cynthia Williams
